it.unica.jpc.parsers

Class JPCParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unica.jpc.parsers.Interpreter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ARTParser

    public class JPCParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to parse the instructions of the program. This class represents a simple parser for the instructions of the framework. It can be invoked to execute an instruction file or to take commands from an interactive shell.

    To make a new parser that checks for a different set of commands it's suggested to extend this class and override the loadCommandsSemantic() method, which is the one responsible for the binding between commands and semantics and for adding them to the command variable.

    Each command is represented as a pair (String, Semantic), contained in the command variable. The String is the command name, which will be looked for by the parser. The Semantic is an interface containing the method Semantic.exec(java.lang.String[]), which is the one that will contain the command instructions. The exec function can use the variables declared in the env variable, which is an instance of JPCParser.Env.

    Follows an example code which uses the above mentioned technique. 

     
  this.command.put("mycommand", new Semantic(){
      public void exec(String args)
      {
          warn("You're now running the " + env.current_command + "command!";
      }
  });
    This example is quite simple but shows everything needed to add a new command.

    • Field Detail

      • CHECK_STRING_START

        public final java.util.regex.Pattern CHECK_STRING_START
        Pattern to check if there's any double quotes in the string.

        Regex: [ ]*".*"

      • CHECK_STRING_MATCHING_DELIMITERS

        public final java.util.regex.Pattern CHECK_STRING_MATCHING_DELIMITERS
        Pattern to check if there are matching double quotes, in the string. Skips escaped quotes (i.e. \").

        Regex: [ ]*".*[^\\]"

      • FIND_WHOLE_STRING

        public final java.util.regex.Pattern FIND_WHOLE_STRING
        Pattern to find pieces of strings surrounded by quotes. Skips escaped quotes (i.e. \").

        Regex: [ ]*"((\\")|[^")])*[^\\]"

    • Method Detail

      • loadCommandsSemantic

        protected void loadCommandsSemantic()
        Creates a binding between each command name and its meaning. If you want to extend the recognized grammar, override this function or edit the 'command' variable.

      • workdir

        protected java.lang.String workdir(java.lang.String path)
        Helper function to use the current work directory. If you need a path to be in the work directory, just use workdir(path) to retrieve the path relative to the work directory.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to a file or folder
        Returns:
        a path relative to the current work directory
